page.title: 17Stanley Park Blackpool Staff
page.content: Commissioned in 1922 by Corporation the park covers 288 acres. Until then the land had no trees or landscaping but is now a remarkable combination of formal and informal gardens, play areas, lake and sports fields. The lake has boats for hire and is much used by local coarse fishermen. This has led to much debate because of the danger to the wildfowl although certain areas of the lake have been set aside for the birds. The park also encloses the Cricket ground where County matches are played and an athletics ground. All the town bedding plants and floral displays are prepared in the park nurseries. The residential drives which encircle the site were conceived as part of the original design and in an effort to retain the character of the land the whole park and its surrounds were declared a Conservation area in 1984.
